QuestionText: The Static Assembler is used to address rules assembly issues due to which cause?
OptionA: The server is managing a large number of rules caches.
OptionB: Access groups contain multiple production rulesets.
OptionC: A new application is migrated to the production system.
OptionD: The application record lists several branch rulesets.
Explanation: The Static Assembler is a Pega tool used to address rules assembly issues specifically when the server is managing a large number of rules caches.

QuestionText: Which two actions do you perform when using the Performance Analyzer (PAL) to ensure that you obtain accurate performance data? (Choose Two)
OptionA: Run the process to completion first to perform needed rule assembly and avoid skewed results.
OptionB: Capture PAL readings after significant changes to a process to identify any performance impact.
OptionC: Capture a PAL reading for a process with good performance to establish a benchmark for comparison.
OptionD: Run PAL as an end user to account for any performance differences due to the portal itself.
Explanation: Running the process to completion first avoids skewed results from rule assembly. Capturing readings after changes helps identify performance impacts.

QuestionText: A user reports that an application takes five seconds to complete a step and present the next step in a process. Which tool allows you to gather and analyze performance data for the form submission?
OptionA: Performance Profiler
OptionB: Performance Analyzer (PAL)
OptionC: Database Trace
OptionD: Tracer
Explanation: The Performance Analyzer (PAL) is the correct tool to gather and analyze performance data for form submissions that take a significant amount of time.

QuestionText: Which two statements about guardrails are true? (Choose Two)
OptionA: Each rule may have multiple guardrail warnings.
OptionB: Pega Platform performs guardrail examination when a rule is checked out.
OptionC: Pega Platform performs guardrail examination when a rule is saved.
OptionD: A developer receives a guardrail warning for rules checked out by other developers.
Explanation: A single rule can have multiple warnings. Guardrail checks are performed upon saving a rule.

QuestionText: Which three statements about the guardrail score are true? (Choose Three)
OptionA: The Application Guardrails landing page counts the number of rules with severe or moderate guardrail warnings.
OptionB: Guardrail scores do not include Pega Platform core rules.
OptionC: The Application Guardrails landing page counts the number of rules with no warnings or caution- level guardrail warnings.
OptionD: A weighted compliance score above 90 signifies that an application is ready for general distribution.
LeftItems: Rules with unjustified warnings are not counted in the compliance score.
Answer 4: B
Explanation: The guardrail score focuses on custom rules, counting severe/moderate warnings, and also rules with no or caution-level warnings to provide a complete picture of application compliance.

QuestionText: An assignment SLA has an initial urgency of 20. Goal is at 5 hours (urgency +10), Deadline is at 8 hours (urgency +20). Passed deadline is every 2 hours (urgency +20) for 5 events. What is the urgency 16 hours after the assignment starts?
Answer 4: Initial (20) + Goal (10) + Deadline (20) + Passed Deadline (20*2 for 12, 14, 16 hours, but limited events might apply). Given the options, 90 is the intended answer, suggesting a specific interpretation of event limits.

QuestionText: Which two configurations are required when adding a Split for Each shape to your case life cycle? (Choose Two)
OptionA: Enter a rule that stores the audit note that you want to include in the subprocess
OptionB: Define when the parent process resumes processing
OptionC: Enter the Page List or Page Group property that is the basis of the split
OptionD: Enable users to get back to the subprocess after the case moves forward
Explanation: A Split For Each shape requires you to define when the parent process continues and the Page List or Page Group property to iterate over.

QuestionText: You have a requirement to associate users in different units to the same work queue. How do you implement this requirement?
OptionA: Associate the users to a common work group. Then associate a work queue to the work group.
OptionB: Associate the users to a common work group. Then associate the work group to the appropriate units.
OptionC: Associate the users to a common unit. Then associate a work queue to the common unit.
OptionD: Associate the users to a common work queue. Then associate the work queue to the appropriate units.
Explanation: To associate users from different units to a single work queue, you link them through a common work group which is then associated with the work queue.

QuestionText: During an Account review case, an accountant wants to evaluate the client's retirement plan. A Retirement planning case is created that runs in parallel with the Account review case. Neither case waits for nor reports to the other. To configure this workflow, which type of parallel processing shape do you use?
OptionA: Spin-off Subprocess
OptionB: Split Join
OptionC: Split For Each
OptionD: Case
Explanation: The Spinoff flow option in a Subprocess shape is used to create a parallel case that runs independently and does not require the parent case to wait.

QuestionText: You configure a child case to override the locking strategy of the parent case. The parent case has a time-out value of one hour. Which time-out value option is recommended for the child case?
OptionA: Set the Access time-out value equal to the parent case time-out value.
OptionB: Set the Access time-out value less than the parent case time-out value.
OptionC: Set the Access time-out value greater than the parent case time-out value.
OptionD: The Access time-out value on the child case cannot be changed.
Explanation: It is recommended to set the child case's time-out value greater than the parent's to prevent locking issues where the child becomes inaccessible while the parent case is still active.

QuestionText: While child cases (Lab analysis, Diagnostic imaging) are active, the attending doctor must be able to update the parent Patient visit case with notes. Which two configurations allow this? (Choose Two)
OptionA: Configure the Patient visit case type to allow multiple users.
OptionB: Configure the Lab analysis and Diagnostic imaging case types to allow other users to open the parent case type.
OptionC: Configure the Lab analysis and Diagnostic imaging case types to allow one user.
OptionD: Configure the Patient visit case type to allow one user.
Explanation: Allowing multiple users on the parent case and configuring child cases to not lock the parent enables concurrent updates by different users.

QuestionText: Which action can a Declare OnChange rule perform when a specified property changes?
OptionA: Suspend the current work object
OptionB: Execute a data transform
OptionC: Update an activity
OptionD: Specify which flow action to run
Explanation: A Declare OnChange rule is designed to automatically execute an action, such as a data transform, when a specified property's value changes.

QuestionText: In which scenario would a Declare OnChange rule be appropriate?
OptionA: During a nightly backup process, only updated fields are backed up.
OptionB: When a developer changes a view, the change is checked into a development branch.
OptionC: When a user updates their address, the active case is suspended until the address can be confirmed.
OptionD: When a manager approves a case, the case is routed back to the appropriate case worker.
Explanation: A Declare OnChange rule is ideal for scenarios requiring an immediate, automatic response to a property change, like routing a case upon approval.

QuestionText: You update an application to AccountManage:01-02-01 and the circumstance .Status='Silver' is no longer needed. How do you implement this change?
OptionA: Create a new version of the circumstanced decision table in AccountManage:01-02-01 and select the Base rule option.
OptionB: Create a new version of the circumstanced decision table in AccountManage:01-02-01 and set the availability of the rule to Withdrawn.
OptionC: Create a new version of the circumstanced decision table in AccountManage:01-02-01 and set the availability of the rule to Blocked.
OptionD: Do nothing. Rule resolution does not consider rules in a lower minor version of a ruleset.
Explanation: Setting the availability of the specific circumstance to 'Blocked' in the new ruleset version prevents it from being chosen by rule resolution, effectively disabling it.

QuestionText: Which two rule types can you mark as a relevant record? (Choose Two)
OptionA: Property
OptionB: Report
OptionC: Skin
OptionD: Section
Explanation: Reports and Sections are common rule types that can be marked as relevant records for easy access and management by business users.

QuestionText: A class group is used to...
OptionA: identify a layer of the Enterprise Class Structure
OptionB: combine related properties by usage
OptionC: assign work to a specific group of users
OptionD: associate child classes with a single database table
Explanation: A class group associates multiple concrete classes with a single database table, a mechanism known as class table inheritance.

QuestionText: What is the difference between using the Call and Branch methods in an activity step to invoke other activities?
OptionA: Call provides more robust debugging capability than Branch, while Branch provides better run-time performance.
OptionB: Branch overrides the security restrictions of the called activity allowing you to easily test code; it will not run in production.
OptionC: Branch creates a new thread to allow asynchronous processing, while Call runs in the thread from it was invoked.
OptionD: Call returns to the originating activity, while Branch skips the remainder of the originating activity.
Explanation: The 'Call' method returns control to the calling activity after the called activity finishes, whereas 'Branch' transfers control permanently.

QuestionText: You saved an existing flow action into a new minor ruleset version, changing its Apply to: class from TRB-HRApps-Work-Feedback to TRB'HRApps-Work. How do you prevent the application from using the original rule in TRB-HRApps-Work-Feedback?
OptionA: Save an additional new version of the flow action applied to TRB-HRApps-Work-Feedback and set the availability to "Blocked".
OptionB: Save an additional new version of the flow action applied to TRB-HRApps-Work-Feedback and set the availability to "Withdrawn".
OptionC: Save an additional new version of the flow action applied to TRB-HRApps-Work-Feedback and set the availability to "Not available".
OptionD: Save an additional new version of the flow action applied to TRB-HRApps-Work and set the availability to "Final".
Explanation: Setting the availability of the old rule version to 'Withdrawn' marks it as no longer valid for use, ensuring the new version is selected by rule resolution.

QuestionText: A medium-size toymaker wants to fulfill orders received during the peak season in December and process the orders in batches multiple times a day. How do you implement this use case?
OptionA: Create one scheduled job and set its run schedule to multiple times a day.
OptionB: Create scheduled jobs, one for each run, that can process accumulated orders.
OptionC: Create batches of orders and send each batch for processing when it gets full.
OptionD: Create a queue processor that can process orders received by the company.
Explanation: Queue processors are designed for high-volume, asynchronous processing, making them suitable for handling large batches of orders efficiently.

QuestionText: Match each log name to its intended purpose.
OptionA: Pega,Alert,AlertSecurity,BIX
OptionB: Captures system exceptions and errors,Records performance-related alerts,Logs security-related events and alerts,Captures data extraction events
OptionC: Pega-Captures system exceptions and errors,Alert-Records performance-related alerts,AlertSecurity-Logs security-related events and alerts,BIX-Captures data extraction events
Answer 4: Pega log is for general system errors, Alert log for performance issues, AlertSecurity for security events, and BIX for data extraction details.

QuestionText: A travel reservation servicing case includes a service level for responding to requests. The service level intervals vary according to passenger status, class of service, and fare type. Which implementation satisfies this requirement?
OptionA: Create a multivariate circumstanced rule and a when rule.
OptionB: Create a multivariate circumstanced rule, a circumstance definition, and a circumstance template.
OptionC: Create a single property circumstanced rule and a when rule.
OptionD: Create a single property circumstanced rule.
Explanation: When a rule needs to vary based on multiple properties (multivariate), you use a combination of a circumstance template, definition, and the circumstanced rule itself.

QuestionText: In your purchasing application, you use a decision table with vendor discount codes. You want to delegate the decision table. In which ruleset do you save the decision table to allow delegation?
OptionA: Organization
OptionB: Integration
OptionC: Production
OptionD: Application
Explanation: Rules intended for delegation to business users should be placed in a Production ruleset, which allows for modification in a production environment.

QuestionText: You are preparing to create a new major version of an application ruleset in which there are multiple minor and patch versions. How do you create the new ruleset version?
OptionA: Use the Ruleset Maintenance wizard to skim the relevant ruleset versions to copy the highest version of existing rules to the new ruleset version.
OptionB: Use the Ruleset Maintenance wizard to merge the existing rules in the relevant ruleset versions to the new version.
OptionC: Use the Application Structure landing page to lock and roll the existing ruleset versions to the new version.
OptionD: Create a new application ruleset using the appropriate version number, then copy the highest version of existing rules into the new ruleset version.
Explanation: The Ruleset Maintenance wizard's 'skim' operation is the standard method for creating a new major version by copying the highest minor/patch versions of rules.

QuestionText: When performing a major version ruleset skim on ruleset ABC, with a current version of ABC:02-02, which of these versions would be considered: 02-01-01, 01-02-01, 02-01-05?
Answer 4: A major skim considers all minor and patch versions within the current major version. It would consider 02-01-01 and 02-01-05, but not 01-02-01.

QuestionText: Which two configurations can you use to include access groups into your Product rule? (Choose Two)
OptionA: Associate the access groups with a ruleset included in the application.
OptionB: Export the access groups using the Access Manager.
OptionC: Add the access groups to the application definition.
OptionD: Add the access group to the Product record in the Individual instances to include section.
Explanation: You can include access groups by associating them with a ruleset in the application or by adding them directly as individual instances to the Product rule.

QuestionText: Multiple teams need to update the same application version during a development cycle. Which two actions do you perform so that the teams do not affect each other's work? (Choose Two)
OptionA: Create a new ruleset version for the base application.
OptionB: Create branches in each team's application.
OptionC: Create a separate production ruleset for each team.
OptionD: Create a new application for each team built on the base application.
Explanation: Using branches allows teams to work in isolated development streams. Creating separate applications built on a common base also provides isolation.

QuestionText: The primary purpose of a production ruleset is to allow rules to be...
OptionA: tested in a production environment
OptionB: updated in a production environment
OptionC: reused in multiple production environments
OptionD: migrated to a production environment
Explanation: Production rulesets are specifically designed to hold rules that business users can update directly in the production environment without a full deployment cycle.

QuestionText: Which two statements are true about database tables in Pega Platform? (Choose Two)
OptionA: The PegaRULES database contains rules while PegaDATA contains work instances.
OptionB: The Database Table rule allows configuration of a connection to a specific table.
OptionC: The History record table contains a record of when each user logged in to the system.
OptionD: The report definition rule should only be used against one table for performance reasons.
Explanation: Pega separates rules (in PegaRULES) from data/work (in PegaDATA). The Database Table rule is used to map a Pega class to a specific database table.

QuestionText: What is the function of class mapping for reports?
OptionA: Ensure all data from one report belongs to a single Case type instance.
OptionB: Create a new Database table record for a Pega Platform class.
OptionC: Assign an ID to a class so reports can reference specific properties.
OptionD: Retrieve data from an associated database table.
Explanation: Class mapping defines the connection between a Pega class and a database table, enabling reports to retrieve data from that table.

QuestionText: A report needs to list the manager's user ID for the operator who creates a time-off case. The report uses data from MyCo-HR-SelfService-Work-TimeOff and Data-Admin-Operator-ID classes. Which two options satisfy this? (Choose Two)
OptionA: Configure a class join on the report definition to join operator information to each case.
OptionB: Add the operator ID to the report definition as a parameter.
OptionC: Use an association rule to join operator information to each case.
OptionD: Specify both classes in the Pages & Classes tab on the report definition.
Explanation: You can link data from different classes in a report by either configuring a direct class join in the report definition or by using a reusable association rule.

QuestionText: If a report is created in the class group MyCo-HR-SelfService-Work, which has child classes for TimeOff and Expense, what instances will the report return?
OptionA: Instances of MyCo-HR-SelfService-Work-TimeOff and MyCo-HR-SelfService-Work-Expense, unless they are stored in different database tables
OptionB: Instances of all Work- derived classes
OptionC: Instances of MyCo-HR-SelfService-Work
OptionD: Instances of MyCo-HR-SelfService-Work-TimeOff and MyCo-HR-SelfService-Work-Expense
Explanation: A report on a class group returns instances of all its child classes, assuming they are stored in the same database table as defined by the class group.

QuestionText: Identify two options for passing data between a Pega application and a webpage containing a web mashup. (Choose Two)
OptionA: Call the function pega.web.api.doAction()
OptionB: Call a Pega API function from the host server
OptionC: Use REST methods to call Pega microservices
OptionD: Use the attribute data-pega-event-onpagedata
Explanation: The Pega Web Mashup API provides the `pega.web.api.doAction()` function for actions and the `data-pega-event-onpagedata` attribute for data exchange.

QuestionText: Which two configurations do you implement when using a Pega Web Mashup? (Choose Two)
OptionA: Leverage the standard authentication service IACAuthentication and update the authentication activities.
OptionB: Add an access group for the application rules that need to be accessed from the external system.
OptionC: Configure a node-level data page to hold security access information about the external system.
OptionD: Configure the application permissions by specifying a list of trusted domains in the application rule.
Explanation: A standard mashup setup involves using the IACAuthentication service and specifying a list of trusted domains (origins) in the application rule for security.

QuestionText: Which requirement is a prerequisite for configuring a Pega Web Mashup?
OptionA: No outstanding Guardrail violations
OptionB: A web server to test your host page
OptionC: At least one work queue in your application
OptionD: At least one Access control policy rule
Explanation: To test a Pega Web Mashup, you need a web server to host the external page where the mashup gadget will be embedded.

QuestionText: Which two statements are valid regarding Pega Web Mashup? (Choose Two)
OptionA: Pega Platform limits mashup users to working on existing cases.
OptionB: Mashup requests are checked for the corresponding mashup channel ID parameter.
OptionC: A mashup can allow access to Dev Studio for full system configuration.
OptionD: A user can view their worklist in an external portal and select items on which to take action.
Explanation: Mashup requests include a channel ID for security validation. A key feature is allowing users to view and act on their worklist from an external web page.

QuestionText: When deploying mashup code in a webpage, which option is necessary to ensure that Pega Platform accepts incoming requests?
OptionA: Ensure the host is configured to support HTTPS.
OptionB: Establish a private tunnel from the host to Pega Platform.
OptionC: Enable authentication policies on Pega Platform.
OptionD: Add the host URL in the Pega application.
Explanation: To ensure security, Pega Platform only accepts mashup requests from hosts that are listed as trusted origins in the application rule.

QuestionText: University admission cases advance automatically if an applicant's test score is above a yearly threshold. Which two configurations support this? (Choose Two)
OptionA: Configure a process with a decision shape that continues if the TestThreshold Configuration setting is less than the applicant's test score.
OptionB: Configure a TestThreshold Configuration setting with the national average for the test score threshold.
OptionC: Configure a TestThreshold Configuration setting that calculates the national average for the test score threshold.
OptionD: Configure a process with a decision shape that continues if the TestThreshold Configuration setting is greater than the applicant's test score.
Explanation: Use a configuration setting to store the threshold and a decision shape in the process to compare the applicant's score against that setting.

QuestionText: A view has a part number field that requires the pattern 'AA1234'. How do you ensure the correct pattern is entered when the user exits the field?
OptionA: Configure a validate rule on the flow action to validate the field with boolean logic.
OptionB: Configure an edit validate rule and call it from a validate rule in the relevant flow action.
OptionC: Configure an edit validate rule and reference it from the property rule for the field.
OptionD: Configure a validate rule to use input-qualified validation configuration.
Explanation: For format-based validation, the best practice is to use an edit validate rule and reference it directly from the property rule's advanced tab.

QuestionText: A requirement states that when a case is assigned for review, its work status is set to Open-Review. Which two steps do you perform to implement this? (Choose Two)
OptionA: Configure a data transform to apply the Open-Review status on the appropriate assignments.
OptionB: Add Open-Review as an allowed status on the case type record.
OptionC: Create a field value record for the Open-Review status.
OptionD: Apply the Open-Review status to the appropriate assignments.
Explanation: You need to define the new status and then apply it. This is typically done in the assignment shape properties or with a data transform.

QuestionText: You should consider using a field value when the list of allowed values is...
OptionA: mostly static
OptionB: three or fewer items
OptionC: specific to one case type
OptionD: shared across all case types
Explanation: Field values are ideal for managing lists of allowed values for a property that are mostly static and may need to be localized.

QuestionText: Application Settings allow you to...
OptionA: simulate data in an environment for testing purposes
OptionB: automate the application migration process
OptionC: execute connectors in parallel to improve performance
OptionD: store references to an external system connected to an application
Explanation: Application Settings are used to manage environment-specific variables, such as URLs or credentials for external systems, without hardcoding them in rules.

QuestionText: Your cloud application is slow when accessing different customer data from an external source via a data page. Which approach solves this performance issue?
OptionA: Access data page with a predefined key so that, once loaded, data access is faster.
OptionB: Fetch only the targeted data from the database each time data is needed so access is faster.
OptionC: Change snapshot data access method to reference pattern data access method.
OptionD: Move to local installation because network traffic in cloud deployment is often slow.
Explanation: Using a keyed data page allows Pega to cache the results for each specific customer (key). Subsequent requests for the same customer's data are served from the cache, which is much faster.

QuestionText: Place the steps in the order in which a service processes a request: 1. Request processing, 2. Map outbound data, 3. Inbound request received, 4. Map inbound data, 5. System returns a response.
BlankAnswers: A service first receives the request, maps the inbound data to the clipboard, processes the request, maps the processing results to outbound data, and finally returns the response.

QuestionText: To reduce training requirements for users, a company wants to utilize the existing front end of their application. How can a third-party application use Pega Platform?
OptionA: By using middleware tools in application servers
OptionB: By using database tables for staging the requests
OptionC: By using REST calls from the Pega API
OptionD: By exposing third-party application services
Explanation: The Pega API provides a set of REST services that allow external applications to create cases, advance workflows, and retrieve data from Pega Platform.

QuestionText: You are updating a system of record using a SOAP connector. If the system is unavailable, you want to retry after an hour. If still unavailable, notify an admin. How do you implement this?
OptionA: Implement the logic in the data page's response data transform.
OptionB: Implement the logic in the connector's error handler flow.
OptionC: Customize the standard pxErrorHandlingTemplate data transform.
OptionD: Use a transition condition in the activity step invoking the connector.
Explanation: The connector's error handler flow is the designated place to configure custom error handling logic, such as retries and notifications.

QuestionText: Which statement is true about services?
OptionA: Services require a REST connector to function.
OptionB: Services return all data in XML format.
OptionC: Services may process outbound requests.
OptionD: Services may use a listener that runs in the background.
Explanation: Services in Pega Platform often use listeners (e.g., for SOAP, REST, JMS) that run in the background to wait for and process incoming requests from external systems.

QuestionText: Which three mobile device features can you leverage by using Pega Mobile Client? (Choose Three)
OptionA: Barcode scanning
OptionB: Text messages
OptionC: Biometric identification
OptionD: Push notifications
Answer 4: C
Explanation: Pega Mobile Client can integrate with native device features like barcode scanning, biometric authentication (fingerprint/face ID), and push notifications.

QuestionText: A courier company wants a mobile app to scan and track parcels collected from remote areas with no internet access. Which mobile app do you develop to fulfill the requirement?
OptionA: Signed app
OptionB: Unsigned app
OptionC: Native app
OptionD: SDK app
Explanation: A signed mobile app can be configured for offline access, allowing users to perform tasks and sync data later when connectivity is restored. 'Signed' refers to it being ready for distribution.

QuestionText: Which two tasks are required to build a mobile app from a Pega Platform application? (Choose Two)
OptionA: Create a certificate set.
OptionB: Configure access to the Pega Mobile Build Server.
OptionC: Configure access to Dev Studio.
OptionD: Set up push notifications to developers.
Explanation: Building a mobile app requires a certificate set for signing the app and configured access to the Pega Mobile Build Server, which compiles the application.

QuestionText: Which two data elements can be used as an attribute for an access control policy? (Choose Two)
OptionA: Appointment date
OptionB: Number of dependents
OptionC: Password string
OptionD: Encrypted bank account number
Explanation: Attributes in an access control policy are typically properties on the case or user profile, such as a date or a number, used to make access decisions.

QuestionText: Which three options do you consider when deciding to use post-processing actions on a flow action? (Choose Three)
OptionA: The effect if the flow action is reloaded
OptionB: The sequence in which the system runs different actions
OptionC: The timing of the commit for the flow action
OptionD: The security setting for the flow action
LeftItems: The potential reuse of the flow action
Answer 4: B
Explanation: When using post-processing, consider what happens on reload, the execution sequence of different action types, and when the data is committed to the database.

QuestionText: A developer has identified resource-intensive queue processors as the source of performance issues. Which two actions do you perform to resolve this? (Choose Two)
OptionA: Associate the queue processors with the appropriate node types.
OptionB: Select the Include in background processing option on the application rule.
OptionC: Configure the queue processors to run multiple times a day.
OptionD: Configure the application nodes with node types.
Explanation: To manage performance, you can configure dedicated nodes for background processing using node types and then associate the resource-intensive queue processors to run on those nodes.

QuestionText: Encrypted properties can be referenced using filter conditions in reports.
OptionA: True
OptionB: False
Answer 2: Encrypted data cannot be used in report filter conditions because the database cannot read the encrypted values to perform the comparison.

QuestionText: Which two use cases correctly describe controlling access to an attachment category? (Choose Two)
OptionA: Configure the When condition "IsCurrentStageTesting" to allow users to view an attachment if the rule returns true.
OptionB: Configure a Visible when condition called "IsDocumentPrivate" to allow users to view an attachment if the rule returns false.
OptionC: Configure the privilege "DeleteOwn" and assign it to a user so that a user can delete their own attachments.
OptionD: Configure Client-based access control on the class where the attachment category exists to restrict access to the attachment.
Explanation: Access to attachment categories can be controlled by privileges (e.g., DeleteOwn) and When conditions that evaluate properties of the case or user.

QuestionText: A requirement states that users with the 'Manager' role can edit any studio work object (Recording, Editing, etc.). At which position in the class hierarchy (UPlusMusic-Production-Work-Studio-) do you configure an Access of Role to Object (ARO) record?
OptionA: UPlusMusic-Production-Work-Brand-Marketing
OptionB: UPlusMusic-Production-Work-Studio-Editing
OptionC: UPlusMusic-Production-Work-Studio-
OptionD: UPlusMusic-Production-Work-
Explanation: To grant access to all child classes, the ARO should be configured on the parent class, UPlusMusic-Production-Work-Studio-, so the permissions are inherited by all studio-related work types.

QuestionText: Which two requirements are supported by Attribute-based access control (ABAC)? (Choose Two)
OptionA: Managers can reschedule but not delete appointments.
OptionB: Personal identifying information in the Work-Baking- class is restricted.
OptionC: Agents assigned the "Top Secret" clearance level can delete reports.
OptionD: Bakers with a rating of 4 or better can add recipes to the database.
Explanation: ABAC is ideal for policies based on attributes, such as allowing an action (reschedule) but not another (delete), or granting permissions based on a property value (rating >= 4).

QuestionText: An auditing policy requires that employees cannot see the contents of complaints made against themselves. Which security solution do you use to satisfy this requirement?
OptionA: Access of Role to Object
OptionB: Access Control Policy
OptionC: Access When
OptionD: Access Deny
Explanation: An Access Control Policy is used for fine-grained, conditional access control, such as preventing a user from seeing a case where they are the subject.

QuestionText: How do you ensure that only a manager can run a specific flow action?
OptionA: Add a pre-processing activity to the flow action form to determine whether the user is a manager.
OptionB: Add a privilege to the flow action form, then add the privilege to a role assigned to the access group for managers.
OptionC: Add an Access When condition to the flow action to determine whether the user is a manager.
OptionD: Add a validate rule to the flow action form to determine whether the user is a manager.
Explanation: The standard way to secure a flow action is to associate a privilege with it and then grant that privilege only to the appropriate roles (e.g., a manager's role).

QuestionText: To ensure that patients can read, but not edit, their ER cases, what two steps do you perform? (Choose Two)
OptionA: Configure an Access of Role to Object rule with the open case action set to 5.
OptionB: Configure an Access Role to Object rule with the open case action set to 1.
OptionC: Configure an access control policy condition to test whether the user is a patient.
OptionD: Create an access group unique to patients.
Explanation: Create a unique access group for patients and an Access of Role to Object rule for that role with read-only access (access level 1).

QuestionText: Which configuration allows doctors and nurses to modify cases in an ER application?
OptionA: Create two access roles, one for doctors and one for nurses, and set the modify action for each to 5.
OptionB: Create two access roles, one for doctors and one for nurses, and set the modify action for each to 1.
OptionC: Create a single access role for both doctors and nurses, and set the modify action to 5.
OptionD: Create a single access role for both doctors and nurses, and set the modify action to 1.
Explanation: To grant full modify access, you would create an access role with the modify action set to 5 (full access) and assign it to both doctors and nurses.

QuestionText: What are three valid ways to exchange data through a Pega Web Mashup? (Choose Three)
OptionA: Use an action object configured as a script to perform additional actions on a web mashup gadget.
OptionB: Use the Javascript function doAction() to set or read data values through the hosting web page.
OptionC: Use an SQL call to exchange data between the mashup and hosting web page.
OptionD: Use a queue processor to pass updated attributes to the gadget on the hosting web page.
LeftItems: Use the data-pega-event-onpagedata attribute to configure the default value for the gadget.
Answer 4: B
Explanation: Data can be exchanged using action objects, the `doAction()` JavaScript function, and the `data-pega-event-onpagedata` attribute for initialization.

QuestionText: Which two statements are valid about configuring Pega Web Mashup? (Choose Two)
OptionA: Only create one DIV element in the hosting web page for each Pega gadget.
OptionB: Add a list of trusted domains in your applications in which you want to use the mashup.
OptionC: Use the Integration wizard to generate mashup code for use in other systems.
OptionD: Keep the original names of default actions in the mashup code to prevent security risks.
Explanation: Each mashup gadget requires its own DIV element on the host page, and for security, you must configure a list of trusted domains (origins) in the application.

QuestionText: Which three items are generated and displayed in the compliance score of an application? (Choose Three)
OptionA: Rules with unjustified warnings in the application
OptionB: Unweighted compliance score out of 100
OptionC: Total core rules used in the application
OptionD: Rules with warnings in the application
LeftItems: Percentage of compliant rules in the application
Answer 4: D
Explanation: The compliance score reflects the health of your custom application rules, showing counts of rules with warnings (justified or not) and the overall percentage of compliant rules.

QuestionText: What is the purpose of the Policy Verification landing page when configuring a security solution in Pega Platform?
OptionA: To test if a user has the required access to a case
OptionB: To manually authenticate a specific user on an integrated external database
OptionC: To test if a user's channel-specific password meets defined property requirements
OptionD: To configure mapping of access control attributes
Explanation: The Policy Verification tool allows you to simulate how access control policies will apply to a specific user and case, helping you test and debug your security configuration.

QuestionText: In a hiring case type, only HR Managers should have read access to a candidate's reference letter attachment. Which two tasks are used to fulfill this requirement? (Choose Two)
OptionA: Configure read access for a user according to a privilege
OptionB: Restrict read access according to a When condition
OptionC: Configure attribute-based access control on the Attachment Category
OptionD: Define a separate Attachment Category for HR Managers
Explanation: Access to attachments can be controlled granularly using a When condition (e.g., checking user's role) or by defining an attribute-based access control (ABAC) policy on the attachment category.

QuestionText: A requirement states that the Manager role cannot open a purchase request during the Audit stage. How do you configure the case stage to satisfy this requirement?
OptionA: Apply an Access Deny record.
OptionB: Apply an Access When record.
OptionC: Apply a When record.
OptionD: Apply a Privilege record.
Explanation: An Access When rule is the correct choice for conditional access based on case context, such as the current stage. It can be configured to deny access for a specific role in a specific stage.

QuestionText: Drag each security solution to its appropriate use case.
OptionA: Access when,Access Control Policy,Access Deny,Access of Role to Object
OptionB: Dealers cannot modify orders in the Fulfillment stage.,Customers can only view their own credit report.,Dealers cannot run reports.,Dealers can modify evaluations.
OptionC: Access when-Dealers cannot modify orders in the Fulfillment stage.,Access Control Policy-Customers can only view their own credit report.,Access Deny-Dealers cannot run reports.,Access of Role to Object-Dealers can modify evaluations.
Answer 4: Access When for stage-based conditions, Access Control Policy for data-specific restrictions, Access Deny for blocking rule types, and ARO for class-level permissions.

QuestionText: What two actions must you perform to create a class join in a report definition? (Choose Two)
OptionA: Select the type of match for key values.
OptionB: Add an association rule to match key values.
OptionC: Create a prefix for the joined class.
OptionD: Add a parameter for each property in the class you want to join.
Explanation: To create a class join, you must define the join type (e.g., inner, left outer) and create a prefix to uniquely identify properties from the joined class.

QuestionText: You are analyzing application performance and identify a data transform exceeding preferred performance parameters. Which performance tool do you use to help troubleshoot the issue?
OptionA: Performance Profiler
OptionB: Database Trace
OptionC: Performance Analyzer (PAL)
OptionD: Tracer
Explanation: The Performance Analyzer (PAL) is used to capture detailed performance metrics over a period of time, which is ideal for identifying which rules, like a data transform, are resource-intensive.

QuestionText: Which statement describes the appropriate use of the Purge/Archive wizard to address application performance?
OptionA: Delete any properties exposed in table columns from the BLOB.
OptionB: Remove old cases to reduce the size of a database table.
OptionC: Delete stored SQL procedures that have been updated.
OptionD: Remove unused rules caches maintained on the system.
Explanation: The Purge/Archive wizard is a tool designed to manage database size by removing or archiving old, resolved case data, which can improve database performance.

QuestionText: Graduate school students and their advisors can each edit the draft proposal. How do you ensure they can simultaneously edit the proposal, and the application can check for changes before committing?
OptionA: Configure the locking on the case type to allow one user.
OptionB: Configure the locking on the case type to allow multiple users.
OptionC: Configure an assignment for the advisor and an assignment for the student.
OptionD: Configure the student and advisor roles with view and edit permission.
Explanation: Configuring the case type locking to 'Allow multiple users' (optimistic locking) enables simultaneous editing and uses mechanisms to handle potential conflicts upon commit.

QuestionText: A flow action calls a pre-processing data transform to initiate values. You want to make sure the values are initiated only once for each flow action. How do you implement this?
OptionA: Add logic to the pre-processing data transform to test if values were already initiated.
OptionB: Do nothing. The pre-processing data transform is only called once for each assignment.
OptionC: Make sure that the flow action does not have the highest likelihood since it will always be invoked.
OptionD: Configure the data transform as post-processing instead of pre-processing.
Explanation: To prevent re-initialization, add logic to the data transform itself to check if the properties already have values before setting them.

QuestionText: Items selected by a user need to be copied to a page list property when the user submits the form. How do you copy the items?
OptionA: Add a data transform to the flow action as a post-processing action.
OptionB: Add a data transform to the flow action as a pre-processing action.
OptionC: Create a declare expression with the page list property as the target.
OptionD: Create a validate rule to copy the selected items.
Explanation: A post-processing data transform on the flow action is the correct mechanism to process data after the user has submitted the form, such as copying selected items.

QuestionText: If a customer reports an issue with their order, an Investigation case is created. All investigation cases are higher priority than other case types. What configuration supports this requirement?
OptionA: Create a service-level agreement (SLA) rule and ensure that the assignment is ready immediately.
OptionB: Create a service-level agreement (SLA) rule and increase the initial urgency.
OptionC: Increase the initial urgency on the case type settings.
OptionD: Configure an optional action to enable manual changes to case urgency.
Explanation: Increasing the initial urgency in an SLA rule for the Investigation case type ensures these cases start with a higher priority and appear higher in worklists.

QuestionText: An SLA has an initial urgency of 20, assignment ready after 2 hours. Goal is at 5 hours (+10 urgency), Deadline is at 2 hours (+25 urgency), and Passed Deadline is every 1 hour (+5 urgency, limit 6 events). What is the urgency 6.5 hours after case creation?
Answer 4: Initial (20) + Deadline at 2 hrs (+25) + Goal at 5 hrs (+10) + Passed Deadline events. The description seems complex, but 95 is the intended answer based on a specific calculation order.

QuestionText: Which two statements about building mobile applications with Pega Platform are true? (Choose Two)
OptionA: Pega Platform allows the same certificate set to build and distribute iOS and Android applications.
OptionB: Pega Mobile Build Server is configured in Dev Studio by using your Android or iOS developer certificates.
OptionC: The containing application determines the layout and appearance of SDK applications.
OptionD: Pega Mobile Build Server requires HTTPS access.
Explanation: Configuring the Pega Mobile Build Server with your developer certificates is a necessary step, and for security, the build server requires an HTTPS connection.

QuestionText: Match each mobile application solution to the correct scenario.
OptionA: SDK application,Signed application,Unsigned application
OptionB: Globobank wants to embed a Pega app in its existing mobile app.,Metrobank wants to distribute their app on public app stores.,Localbank wants to build an app but cannot distribute developer certificates.
OptionC: SDK application-Globobank wants to embed a Pega app in its existing mobile app.,Signed application-Metrobank wants to distribute their app on public app stores.,Unsigned application-Localbank wants to build an app but cannot distribute developer certificates.
Answer 4: SDK for embedding, Signed for public distribution, and Unsigned for internal testing or when certificates are unavailable.

QuestionText: Which statement is true about connectors?
OptionA: Connectors use a listener that runs in the background.
OptionB: Connectors establish a link to a service on another system.
OptionC: Connectors require a REST service to function.
OptionD: Connectors can be referenced from data transforms.
Explanation: Connectors are rules that enable a Pega application to call and interact with an external service or system.

QuestionText: As a best practice, in which situation do you use a keyed data page?
OptionA: A user selects an emoji from a short list that updates often.
OptionB: A user selects a replacement part from a long list that seldom changes.
OptionC: A user selects a delivery option from a short list that rarely changes.
OptionD: A user selects an image from a long list that updates often.
Explanation: Keyed data pages are most effective for retrieving specific instances from a large, relatively static dataset, such as looking up a specific part from a catalog.

QuestionText: What are the two most common ways to expose your application to an external system? (Choose Two)
OptionA: Create a connector linked to a data page.
OptionB: Leverage the Pega API.
OptionC: Configure a signed certificate.
OptionD: Create a web service with the Service wizard.
Explanation: The primary methods for exposing Pega functionality are through the built-in Pega API (for REST services) or by creating custom web services (SOAP or REST) using the Service wizard.

QuestionText: You are asked to create a custom status named Open-Review for assignments in one application. How do you satisfy the request?
OptionA: Create a Field Value record named Open-Review for .pyStatusWork with the Apply To class set to the class group.
OptionB: Add the Open-Review status to the Application record for the application.
OptionC: Circumstance the existing Open Field Value record on the application name and update the status value to Open-Review.
OptionD: Create a Field Value record named Open-Review for .pyStatusWork and configure an Access When record to apply the status to the correct application.
Explanation: To create a custom status, you define a Field Value rule for the .pyStatusWork property, setting its 'Apply To' class to the appropriate class group for your application.

QuestionText: You want to create a new minor version of an application ruleset for a new feature with a phased rollout. How do you update the application to add the new ruleset version?
OptionA: Create a branch ruleset and a new application, and add the branch ruleset to the application.
OptionB: Lock and roll the existing ruleset, and create a new application version.
OptionC: Lock and roll the existing ruleset, and update the existing application version.
OptionD: Create a new application version and add the new ruleset version as a production ruleset.
Explanation: The standard process is to lock the current ruleset version and create a new minor version (roll). Then, update the existing application definition to reference this new ruleset version.

QuestionText: Given ruleset prerequisites (MyCo requires MyCoInt and Customer; MyCoInt requires Pega-ProcessCommander) and application validation rulesets (Homelns, Homelnslnt), which statement is correct?
OptionA: Rules in MyCo can reference rules in Homelnslnt.
OptionB: Rules in MyCo can reference rules in Homelns.
OptionC: Rules in Customer can reference rules in Homelns.
OptionD: Rules in MyCoInt can reference rules in Customer.
Explanation: A rule in MyCo can reference rules in any of its prerequisite rulesets (MyCoInt, Customer) and also any rulesets available through application validation (Homelns, Homelnslnt).

QuestionText: Teams X and Y work on different enhancements in the same ruleset with uncertain release dates. Which two options, when performed together, allow each team to keep its work separate? (Choose Two)
OptionA: Create a new ruleset version for one of the teams.
OptionB: Create a branch ruleset for each team.
OptionC: Apply privileges to the rules each team configures.
OptionD: Create access groups for each of the teams.
Explanation: Creating a separate ruleset version and using branch rulesets are the primary mechanisms in Pega for enabling parallel development while keeping work isolated.

QuestionText: Organize the classes and associated rules in the appropriate Enterprise Class Structure (ECS) layer.
OptionA: Organization,Division,Implementation,Unit
OptionB: Standard confirmation email,Regional marketing campaign,Budgeting application,HR department policies
OptionC: Organization-Standard confirmation email,Division-Regional marketing campaign,Implementation-Budgeting application,Unit-HR department policies
Answer 4: Organization for enterprise-wide rules, Division for regional rules, Implementation for specific applications, and Unit for department-level rules.

QuestionText: A rule in TGB-HR-SelfService-Work-TimeOff references a rule named ConfirmationRequest. Given the ruleset list and available instances, which is chosen by rule resolution?
OptionA: TGB-HR-SelfService-Work-TimeOff .ConfirmationRequest (SelfService:01-01-01)
OptionB: TGB .ConfirmationRequest (TGB:01-01-02)
OptionC: TGB-HR-SelfService-Work .ConfirmationRequest (SelfService:01-01-01)
OptionD: TGB-HR-5elfService-Work-TimeOff .ConfirmationRequest (SelfService:01-01-02)
Explanation: Rule resolution selects the most specific rule available in the highest ruleset. It will find the rule in the exact 'Apply To' class first.

QuestionText: A global application requires certain operations to start at midnight GMT. Select two possible designs. (Choose Two)
OptionA: Use the Run in background step in the case life cycle and design a standard queue processor.
OptionB: Use the Queue-For-Processing method in an activity and design a dedicated queue processor.
OptionC: Use the Queue-For-Processing method in an activity and design a standard queue processor.
OptionD: Use the Run in background step in the case life cycle and design a dedicated queue processor.
Explanation: To schedule a task for a specific time, you would use the Queue-For-Processing method in an activity, which can defer processing until the specified time. This can be handled by either a standard or dedicated queue processor.

QuestionText: Select the three Pega best practices for developing activities. (Choose Three)
OptionA: Keep activities short. Limit your activities to fewer than 15 steps.
OptionB: Limit activity calls to at most three to prevent performance problems.
OptionC: Limit custom Java steps whenever possible.
OptionD: Use only activities to support queue processing and interfaces.
LeftItems: Limit the use of activities. Use alternative rule types such as data transforms whenever possible.
Answer 4: C
Explanation: Best practices emphasize limiting the use of activities in favor of declarative rules, keeping them short and simple, and avoiding custom Java.

QuestionText: While running an application, a user notes that a system exception occurred. Which log do you review to identify the issue?
OptionA: Pega
OptionB: Alert
OptionC: AlertSecunty
OptionD: BIX
Explanation: General system exceptions and errors are captured in the Pega log (also known as PegaRULES log).

QuestionText: There are five instances of a rule. On 1 June 2020, which instance is chosen by rule resolution if .Country = Algeria, given rulesets from 01-01-01 to 01-01-05?
Answer 4: Rule resolution prioritizes the most specific circumstance. The rule circumstanced for .Country=Algeria will be chosen over base rules or date-circumstanced rules.

QuestionText: A company with multiple applications spanning different business units wants to send a standard confirmation email to customers whenever a case is created. Which is the appropriate layer of the Enterprise Class Structure (ECS) for the email correspondence?
OptionA: Unit
OptionB: Organization
OptionC: Implementation
OptionD: Division
Explanation: Common, reusable assets like a standard email correspondence that apply across the entire enterprise belong in the Organization layer of the ECS.

QuestionText: Which two statements describe the role of the cache manifest in a mobile app? (Choose two.)
OptionA: Allows downloading of rules for offline use with a mobile app.
OptionB: Provides access to static resources such as HTML files, image files, or JS files.
OptionC: Enables users to continue interacting with mobile apps while offline.
OptionD: Supports debugging efforts by providing a run-time view of the rules accessed by the app.
Explanation: The cache manifest lists all the resources (rules, static files) that a browser should cache for offline access, enabling the mobile app to function without a network connection.

QuestionText: Which two design configurations limit the need for horizontal scrolling when an application is used on a mobile device? (Choose two.)
OptionA: Use grid layouts rather than repeating dynamic layouts to display tabular data.
OptionB: Set the importance for columns in repeating dynamic layouts.
OptionC: Limit text fields to a width of 200 pixels.
OptionD: Set the width for layouts in percentages.
Explanation: Setting column importance in repeating layouts allows the UI to responsively hide less important columns on small screens. Using percentage-based widths allows layouts to fluidly adapt to the screen size.

QuestionText: You want to allow users to use an application on a mobile device, even if the device is not connected to a network. Which configuration option supports this requirement?
OptionA: Simulate external data sources when the application is offline.
OptionB: Source repeating layouts using report definitions.
OptionC: Configure UI elements to use native controls on mobile devices.
OptionD: Source drop-down lists using data pages.
Explanation: For offline functionality, UI elements like drop-down lists must be sourced from data pages that are configured to be available in offline mode.

QuestionText: Offline support requires which two configurations? (Choose two.)
OptionA: Access groups set up to allow offline access to users.
OptionB: Appropriate case types configured for offline processing.
OptionC: An authorization activity to manage offline permissions.
OptionD: A set of privileges to run sections in an offline environment.
Explanation: Enabling offline support requires configuring the access group for offline mode and ensuring the specific case types are marked as available for offline processing.

QuestionText: Which two configurations can you use to include access groups into your Product rule? (Choose two.)
OptionA: Export the access groups using the Access Manager.
OptionB: Add the access groups to the application record.
OptionC: Add the access group to the Product record in the Individual instances to include section.
OptionD: Associate the access groups with a ruleset included in the application.
Explanation: You can include access groups in a product rule by either adding them to the application record itself or by explicitly adding them as individual instances to include.

QuestionText: Your application contains several circumstanced versions of a service level. To update the application, the service level is no longer circumstanced for AccountOpen cases but must be retained for others. How do you reset the circumstancing for AccountOpen?
OptionA: Copy the non-circumstanced rule to the AccountOpen class and select the base rule option.
OptionB: Make the circumstanced rules in the AccountOpen class unavailable.
OptionC: Withdraw the circumstanced rules in the AccountOpen class.
OptionD: Block the circumstanced rules in the AccountOpen class.
Explanation: Withdrawing a rule is the correct approach to prevent a specific circumstanced version from being used, allowing rule resolution to fall back to the base or another appropriate version.

QuestionText: Which two statements are valid regarding Pega Web Mashups? (Choose two.)
OptionA: A mashup display starts by calling either a flow or a harness from a Pega application.
OptionB: Pega Platform limits a mashup to working on existing cases.
OptionC: A mashup can allow access to Dev Studio for full system configuration.
OptionD: A user can view their worklist in an external portal and select items to take action on.
Explanation: A mashup works by embedding a Pega harness or flow. A common use case is to display a user's worklist in an external portal, from which they can open and work on assignments.

QuestionText: A form must support accessibility. How do you enable a user to specify a date?
OptionA: Configure a text box to allow date entry.
OptionB: Use a calendar control that displays an entire year.
OptionC: Use a calendar control that displays an entire month.
OptionD: Provide separate controls for month, day, and year.
Explanation: For accessibility, a monthly calendar control is preferred as it is easier to navigate with a keyboard or screen reader than a yearly view or separate controls.

QuestionText: A client requests that you add a footer to the Case Manager portal. How do you satisfy this request?
OptionA: Update the portal format in the skin applied to the portal.
OptionB: Update the portal type on the portal record.
OptionC: Change the section layout on the harness referenced on the portal record.
OptionD: Configure a navigation record to describe the new portal format.
Explanation: The overall layout of a portal, including its header and footer, is defined by the portal format within the application's skin rule.

QuestionText: On which type of rule can you configure edit validate rules?
OptionA: Properties
OptionB: Flow actions
OptionC: Activities
OptionD: Case types
Explanation: Edit validate rules are specifically configured on Property rules to perform format-level validation on the property's value.

QuestionText: When designing reports with multiple data sources, in which two ways is an association rule different from a class join? (Choose two.)
OptionA: You can join multiple classes with class joins, while you cannot join multiple classes with associations.
OptionB: Anyone with the appropriate permissions can use associations when creating reports in the User portal.
OptionC: Class joins are unique to each report. Associations are reusable in any report.
OptionD: A class join is required to add a filter condition to your report.
Explanation: Associations are reusable rules that can be leveraged by end users in the reporting portal, whereas class joins are configured specifically within a single report definition.

QuestionText: A Fulfillment report needs the user ID of the employee who packages an order. The report uses data from MyCo-Orders-Work-Ship and Data-Admin-Operator-ID classes. Which two options satisfy this? (Choose two.)
OptionA: Configure a class join on the Fulfillment report definition to join operator information to each case.
OptionB: Add the user ID to the Fulfillment report definition as a parameter.
OptionC: Specify both classes on the Pages & Classes tab on the Fulfillment report definition.
OptionD: Use an association rule to join operator information to each case to populate the Fulfillment report.
Explanation: To combine data from the two classes, you can either create a specific class join within the report or use a pre-defined, reusable association rule.

QuestionText: Which three items are generated and displayed in the compliance score of an application? (Choose three.)
OptionA: Rules with warnings in the application
OptionB: Pega Platform core rules used in the application
OptionC: Rules with unjustified warnings in the application
OptionD: Unweighted compliance score
LeftItems: Percentage of compliant rules in the application
Answer 4: C
Explanation: The compliance score displays the number of rules with warnings, rules with unjustified warnings, and the overall percentage of compliant rules in your application.

QuestionText: Drag the Pega Platform log file appender to its use case.
OptionA: PegaRULES-SecurityEvent.log,PegaRULES-Alert.log,PegaRULES.log,PegaRULES-BIX.log
OptionB: Security-related events,Performance alerts,General system messages,BIX extraction operations
OptionC: PegaRULES-SecurityEvent.log-Security-related events,PegaRULES-Alert.log-Performance alerts,PegaRULES.log-General system messages,PegaRULES-BIX.log-BIX extraction operations
Answer 4: Each log file is designated for a specific purpose: security events, performance alerts, general messages, and BIX operations.

QuestionText: You perform a major skim on the ruleset ABC:02-02-01 to ABC:03-01-01. Which ruleset versions does the skim operation use from this list: 02-01-01, 01-02-01, 02-01-05?
Answer 4: A major skim considers all rules in the highest available minor and patch versions of the major version being skimmed. In this case, it would use rules from the 02-XX-XX versions.

QuestionText: A Rule-Admin-Product instance is created to migrate an application. Which two components does the archive file include by default? (Choose two.)
OptionA: Checked-in rules
OptionB: MyCo- class instances
OptionC: Data- class instances
OptionD: Checked-out rules
Explanation: By default, a product rule includes all checked-in application rules and associated data instances (like those in MyCo- classes), but not checked-out rules.

QuestionText: A data page retrieves data from an external system. If an error occurs, you want to display a message and email an admin. How do you implement this?
OptionA: Configure an activity's input source as the error message and the output as an email.
OptionB: Configure an error handling process that displays the error message and sends an email.
OptionC: Reuse the out-of-the-box ConnectionProblem error handling flow on the Service tab for the connector.
OptionD: Create an error handler data transform that adds an error message to the data page and sends an email.
Explanation: A dedicated error handling process (like a flow) configured on the data page's load mechanism is the correct way to handle complex error logic like displaying a message and sending an email.

QuestionText: A chemical supplier provides a material safety data sheet (MSDS) for 100+ products. The MSDS rarely changes. When a buyer selects an item, the MSDS is displayed. Which option ensures the MSDS is up to date?
OptionA: Create a keyed data page with the MSDS for each cleaning product.
OptionB: Create a parameterized data page that loads a new MSDS for each product.
OptionC: Create a data page that contains the MSDS for each cleaning product.
OptionD: Configure a keyed data page that allows multiple pages for each key.
Explanation: A keyed data page is ideal here. Allowing multiple pages per key means the system can cache the MSDS for each product ID, ensuring fast retrieval for a large, static dataset.

QuestionText: A fitness organization requires correct data entry on its membership form. Which scenario requires an edit validate rule?
OptionA: Existing members must enter their membership number in the correct format, M-######-0#.
OptionB: The first and last name are required on the form, but a middle name or initial is optional.
OptionC: New members can get a 20% discount, if they enter the Coupon Code SAVE.
OptionD: New members must be at least 18 years of age at the time they sign up for membership.
Explanation: Edit validate rules are specifically used to enforce a specific format or pattern on a field, such as the membership number format.

QuestionText: As a best practice, in which situation do you configure a keyed data page?
OptionA: A long list of images that often changes
OptionB: A long list of vehicle parts that rarely changes
OptionC: A short list of emojis that often changes
OptionD: A short list of delivery options that rarely changes
Explanation: Keyed data pages are most efficient for retrieving a single instance from a large list of data that does not change often, like a vehicle parts catalog.

QuestionText: A city resident can report potholes to the Department of Transportation by logging in to a mobile Pega Platform application that utilizes the Pega API. Which two Pega API interactions do you use to facilitate this? (Choose two.)
OptionA: Submit the report using POST /cases
OptionB: Access the related case type to report using GET /casetypes
OptionC: Update the report using GET /cases
OptionD: Log into the application using PUT /authenticate
Explanation: To create a case, the mobile app would first use GET /casetypes to find the correct case type and then POST /cases to create the new pothole report case.

QuestionText: In which two scenarios is it a Pega best practice to use Pega Web Mashup over a Pega API integration? (Choose two.)
OptionA: Minimal resources are assigned to update Pega Platform for each new release.
OptionB: Developers have access to only App Studio when configuring the integration.
OptionC: Users are expected to create cases, open assignments, and manage data privacy.
OptionD: The application is built on Pega Platform version 8.2 using UI Kit.
Explanation: A mashup is preferable when you want to embed Pega's UI and full case processing capabilities into an external site, especially if development resources for a full API integration are limited.

QuestionText: An SLA has an initial urgency of 15. Ready after 2 hours. Goal is at 1 hour (+10 urgency), Deadline is at 2 hours (+15 urgency), Passed Deadline is every 1 hour (+10 urgency, limit 10 events). What is the urgency 4.5 hours after the case reaches the assignment?
Answer 4: Initial (15) + Goal at 1 hr (+10) + Deadline at 2 hrs (+15) + 2 passed deadline events at 3 and 4 hrs (+20) = 60.

QuestionText: The MyCoSelfService ruleset has multiple versions of the same rule with different circumstance settings. If .Country = Japan, which ruleset version is chosen?
Explanation: Rule resolution will select the most specific rule that matches the context. If a version is specifically circumstanced for 'Japan', it will be chosen over non-circumstanced or differently circumstanced rules.

QuestionText: You perform a major skim on ruleset ABC:02-02-01 to ABC:03-01-01. From the list (02-01-01, 01-02-01, 02-01-05), select the versions the skim operation uses.
Answer 4: A major skim copies the highest version of each rule from all minor/patch versions within the major version being skimmed (in this case, major version 02).

QuestionText: Several development teams work on different enhancements with uncertain release dates. Which two options, when performed together, allow each team to keep its work separate? (Choose Two)
OptionA: Create a new application for each team.
OptionB: Create a new ruleset version for each team.
OptionC: Set up a branch ruleset for each team.
OptionD: Create a production ruleset for each team.
Explanation: Using separate ruleset versions and branch rulesets are the two primary strategies in Pega for enabling parallel, isolated development by multiple teams.

QuestionText: In which situation do you configure branched rulesets?
OptionA: One team creates a new patch for an application while another team creates a new major version of the application.
OptionB: You need to delegate rules to process owners from the business.
OptionC: Multiple teams need to work on the same application version.
OptionD: A team needs to work on the next version of an application while preparing to migrate the current version.
Explanation: Branched rulesets are specifically designed to support concurrent development, where multiple teams work on features within the same application version simultaneously.

QuestionText: A budgeting application uses a job scheduler to email customers weekly. Due to international usage, stakeholders require peak performance at all hours. Which solution addresses this?
OptionA: Configure the job scheduler to run at off-hours.
OptionB: Ensure that customers use a common access group.
OptionC: Dedicate and classify a node for the job scheduler.
OptionD: Limit the number of operators who can access the application.
Explanation: To prevent background jobs from impacting user performance, you should dedicate a specific server node for background processing (like the job scheduler) by classifying it.

QuestionText: Which two value types can be used in an Application Setting when modifying values for each production level? (Choose Two)
OptionA: Data transform
OptionB: Text
OptionC: Picklist
OptionD: Class
Explanation: Application Settings support simple value types like Text and Picklist to allow for easy configuration of environment-specific variables.

QuestionText: A Pega PlatformTM application has just been integrated with an external data source. Which of the following tests do you perform to ensure that the integration passes data as expected?
OptionA: Scenario test
OptionB: Automation test
OptionC: Performance test
OptionD: Unit test
Explanation: A unit test is the most appropriate initial test to verify that a specific piece of functionality, like an integration connector, is working correctly in isolation.

QuestionText: Which two statements about keyed data pages are true? (Choose Two)
OptionA: A keyed data page is required for all data pages.
OptionB: A keyed data page can use a report definition.
OptionC: A keyed data page can return multiple embedded pages.
OptionD: A keyed data page can have multiple keys.
Explanation: A keyed data page can be configured to return a list of results (multiple embedded pages) and can be defined with a composite key made of multiple properties.

QuestionText: Drag the error type on the left to its description on the right.
OptionA: Transient Errors,Permanent Errors
OptionB: These errors usually correct themselves over time.,These errors are typically due to a configuration error or an error in the remote application logic.
OptionC: Transient Errors-These errors usually correct themselves over time.,Permanent Errors-These errors are typically due to a configuration error or an error in the remote application logic.
Answer 4: Transient errors are temporary and may resolve on retry, while permanent errors indicate a fundamental issue that requires a fix.

QuestionText: In which example would you use the application settings feature?
OptionA: A data page is available across multiple user sessions and is updated once a day.
OptionB: An IT service application stores a list of operating systems using a Pega system of record.
OptionC: A weather service application points to a web service for weather data.
OptionD: A manager can update the price of a service without a developer editing the application.
Explanation: Application settings are ideal for storing environment-specific endpoints, such as the URL for an external web service.

QuestionText: You are sending information to an external system of record by using a connector. What do you use to implement this requirement?
OptionA: Call a connector from a Save data page step.
OptionB: Create a new external data source.
OptionC: Configure a service rule and listener.
OptionD: Reference a connector from a data transform.
Explanation: Connectors are typically invoked from procedural rules like activities, or from a data transform when using a savable data page, to send data to an external system.

QuestionText: In which log can you see performance-related alerts that are triggered when an operation exceeds the specified performance threshold?
OptionA: ALERTSECURITY log
OptionB: PEGA log
OptionC: ALERT log
OptionD: BIX log
Explanation: The ALERT log is specifically designed to record performance-related alerts, such as long-running queries or interactions that exceed configured time thresholds.

QuestionText: Which two situations are likely to negatively impact application performance? (Choose Two)
OptionA: A report definition generates report data based on several properties stored in the BLOB.
OptionB: Business architects have delegated a large number of rules to process owners.
OptionC: A developer uses an SQL query tool or activities to archive case data before purging tables.
OptionD: Several applications on the system write cases to the pr_other table in the database.
Explanation: Reporting on unexposed properties in the BLOB causes full table scans. Using non-standard tools for archiving can be inefficient and lock database tables, impacting performance.

QuestionText: You have identified an activity that does not perform well. You need to find out exactly which steps in the activity are causing the poor performance. Which tool allows you to identify the cause?
OptionA: Database Trace
OptionB: Performance Analyzer (PAL)
OptionC: Tracer
OptionD: Performance Profiler
Explanation: The Tracer tool provides a detailed, step-by-step execution trace of rules, including activities, showing the time taken for each step, which is ideal for pinpointing bottlenecks.

QuestionText: Consider the following requirement: Car dealers cannot modify orders in the Fulfillment stage. Which security solution do you use to satisfy the requirement?
OptionA: Access of Role to Object
OptionB: Access When
OptionC: Access group
OptionD: Access Deny
Explanation: Access of Role to Object (ARO) rules are used to control access to instances of a class based on user role. You can specify conditional logic, such as the case stage, within the ARO.

QuestionText: How do you enable field-level auditing for properties?
OptionA: Add a field validation to the case workflow.
OptionB: Add an auditing optional action to the case workflow.
OptionC: Enable the auditing feature on the property rule forms.
OptionD: Enable field-level auditing for the case type.
Explanation: Field-level auditing is configured directly on the property rule form by enabling the 'Audit changes to this property' setting.

QuestionText: Which three types of information can represent an attribute in attribute-based access control (ABAC)? (Choose Three)
OptionA: List of strings
OptionB: Property
OptionC: Boolean
OptionD: Single string
Answer 4: C
Explanation: Attributes in ABAC policies are typically based on properties from the case or user profile, which can be of various types like boolean, string, or number.

QuestionText: Filter conditions cannot reference encrypted properties in reports.
OptionA: True
OptionB: False
Answer 2: When a property's value is encrypted in the database, it cannot be used in report filter conditions because the database cannot perform a comparison on the encrypted text.

QuestionText: In an online shopping app, you enable class-level encryption and optimize several properties. To secure sensitive data, how do you enable property-level encryption for SSN and Account Number?
OptionA: Create a PropertyEncrypt data transform, and then add the properties.
OptionB: Create a PropertyEncrypt access control policy, and then add the properties.
OptionC: Create a TextEncrypted property type, and then add the properties.
OptionD: Update the class-level encryption to enable property-level encryption.
Explanation: Property-level encryption is configured using an Access Control Policy of type 'PropertyEncrypt', where you specify the properties to be encrypted.

QuestionText: A courier company wants to create a mobile app to scan and track parcels collected from remote areas that are without internet access. Which mobile app do you develop to fulfill the requirement?
OptionA: SDK app
OptionB: Native app
OptionC: Unsigned app
OptionD: Signed app
Explanation: A native app is installed directly on the device and can be designed with offline capabilities, making it suitable for use in areas without internet access.

QuestionText: Which two methods allow you to identify the Pega Platform application type? (Choose Two)
OptionA: View the Settings tab of the case designer.
OptionB: View the Application layers widget for the ruleset stack.
OptionC: View the Application definition rule.
OptionD: View the portals used by the application.
Explanation: The application definition rule contains the core definition, and the application layers widget shows the ruleset stack, both of which reveal the structure and type of application.

QuestionText: Which two configurations must you make when you add a Split for Each shape to your case life cycle? (Choose Two)
OptionA: Enter a unique name for the shape in the Split for Each field.
OptionB: Define a condition to control when the flow runs for each iteration of the subprocess.
OptionC: Enter the Page List or Page Group property that is the basis of the split.
OptionD: Define when the parent process resumes processing.
Explanation: A Split for Each shape fundamentally requires the Page List/Group to iterate over and a condition specifying when the main process should continue.

QuestionText: You decide to use multiple pre-processing actions on a single flow action. Place them in the order in which they are executed: Run robotic automation, Apply data transform, Run activity.
Answer 5: Apply data transform,Run activity,Run robotic automation
BlankAnswers: Pega executes pre-processing actions in a specific order: data transforms first, then activities, then robotic automations.

QuestionText: An SLA has an initial urgency of 20, ready after 1 hour. Goal is 5 hours (+10 urgency), Deadline is 8 hours (+20 urgency), Passed deadline is every 2 hours (+20 urgency, limit 5 events). What is the urgency 16 hours after assignment?
Answer 4: Initial (20) + Goal (+10) + Deadline (+20) + Passed Deadline (4 events * 20 = 80) = 130.

QuestionText: Which two options do you consider when creating a pre-processing data transform? (Choose Two)
OptionA: The timing of the commit for the flow action
OptionB: The potential reuse of the flow action
OptionC: The security setting for the flow action
OptionD: The effect if the flow action is reloaded
Explanation: You need to consider when the data commit happens relative to the transform and what happens if the user reloads the screen, as the transform might run again.

QuestionText: In the hierarchy of a single organization, which statement about the relationship between organizational elements is true?
OptionA: A work queue belongs to a single operator record.
OptionB: A unit can belong to multiple organizations.
OptionC: An operator record can belong to multiple units.
OptionD: A work group can have more than one manager.
Explanation: A work group can be configured with multiple managers to allow for shared oversight and responsibility.

QuestionText: You are integrating two Pega Web Mashups into a client's mortgage loan financing page. What do you configure to successfully embed both mashups?
OptionA: Load both mashups simultaneously.
OptionB: Define identical URLs for each mashup.
OptionC: Identify unique names for each mashup.
OptionD: Run the mashups on the same thread.
Explanation: Each mashup gadget requires a unique name or ID within the host page's HTML to differentiate it from other gadgets and allow for independent initialization and communication.
